template.name: Frequently Asked Questions

div.h3: What is Angular, and why should I use it for my project?

div.p: Angular is a robust, open-source web application framework by Google. It is designed to simplify the development and testing of SPAs, offering a robust structure and set of tools for creating dynamic and scalable projects. Angular offers features like two-way binding, dependency injection, and modular architecture, streamlining development processes and improving performance. It allows you to ensure a maintainable and efficient codebase, strong community support, and rich user interfaces.

div.h3: What kind of projects is Angular best suited for?

div.p: Angular is best suited for large-scale, complex web solutions that require a solid foundation and high performance. It excels in projects that involve SPAs, enterprise-level apps, eCommerce platforms, real-time data apps, PWAs, and CMS.

div.h3: What is the difference between AngularJS and Angular?

div.p: AngularJS (2010) is based on JavaScript, while Angular (2016) is a complete rewrite based on TypeScript. The main differences include architecture, where AngularJS uses a scope and controller-based system, and Angular adopts a component-based approach. Angular offers enhanced performance, faster load times, a more modular structure for easier management and scalability, and superior tooling support, including a powerful CLI, ahead-of-time compilation, and improved testing capabilities.

div.h3: Why should I migrate from AngularJS to Angular?

div.p: Migrating from AngularJS to Angular offers several benefits, such as Enhanced Performance, Better Tooling, Long-term Support, Modern Features, and more. This clearly signifies why you should migrate to Angular from AngularJS.
